.git/hooks/commit-msg.sample

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #!/bin/sh
00002 #
00003 # An example hook script to check the commit log message.
00004 # Called by "git commit" with one argument, the name of the file
00005 # that has the commit message.  The hook should exit with non-zero
00006 # status after issuing an appropriate message if it wants to stop the
00007 # commit.  The hook is allowed to edit the commit message file.
00008 #
00009 # To enable this hook, rename this file to "commit-msg".
00010 
00011 # Uncomment the below to add a Signed-off-by line to the message.
00012 # Doing this in a hook is a bad idea in general, but the prepare-commit-msg
00013 # hook is more suited to it.
00014 #
00015 # SOB=$(git var GIT_AUTHOR_IDENT | sed -n 's/^\(.*>\).*$/Signed-off-by: \1/p')
00016 # grep -qs "^$SOB" "$1" || echo "$SOB" >> "$1"
00017 
00018 # This example catches duplicate Signed-off-by lines.
00019 
00020 test "" = "$(grep '^Signed-off-by: ' "$1" |
00021      sort | uniq -c | sed -e '/^[   ]*1[    ]/d')" || {
00022     echo >&2 Duplicate Signed-off-by lines.
00023     exit 1
00024 }
